capabilities.name: User-centric focus
capabilities.description: A focus on user needs is essential to ensure that AI-accelerated teams are moving quickly in the right direction.

capabilities.name: Strong version control practices
capabilities.description: As AI increases the velocity of change, version control becomes the critical safety net that enables confident experimentation.

capabilities.name: AI-accessible internal data
capabilities.description: Connecting AI to your internal documentation and codebases moves it from a generic assistant to a specialized expert.

capabilities.name: Working in small batches
capabilities.description: This discipline counteracts the risk of AI generating large, unstable changes, ensuring that speed translates to better product performance.

capabilities.name: Clear + communicated AI stance
capabilities.description: Ambiguity creates risk. A clear policy provides the psychological safety needed for effective experimentation.

capabilities.name: Quality internal platform
capabilities.description: A platform provides the automated, secure pathways that allow AI’s benefits to scale across the organization.

capabilities.name: Healthy data ecosystems
capabilities.description: The benefits of AI are significantly amplified by high-quality, accessible, and unified internal data.

outcomes.name: Team performance
outcomes.description: The perceived effectiveness and collaborative strength of an individual’s immediate team.

outcomes.name: Code quality
outcomes.description: An individual’s assessment of the quality of code underlying the primary application or service they work on.

outcomes.name: Individual effectiveness
outcomes.description: An individual’s self-assessed effectiveness and sense of accomplishment at work.

outcomes.name: Product performance
outcomes.description: The success and quality of the products or services the team is building, based on characteristics like helping users accomplish important tasks and keeping information safe, and performance metrics such as latency.

outcomes.name: Reduced friction
outcomes.description: Friction is the result of obstacles which hinder an individual’s work. Lower amounts of friction are generally considered to be a positive outcome.

outcomes.name: Software delivery throughput
outcomes.description: The speed and efficiency of the software delivery process.

outcomes.name: Organizational performance
outcomes.description: The overall success of the organization, based on characteristics like profitability, market share, and customer satisfaction.
